data.title: South China Morning Post
data.text:
Thanks to the ‘innovative’ organisers, Andrew Parsons believes there will be a ‘before Paris’ and ‘after Paris’ for the Paralympic movement.

The HMD Barbie Phone by HMD Global and Mattel cannot access Instagram, TikTok or any other apps, and has a keypad that lights up in the dark. Good for ‘the odd day of detox’, one analyst says.

Police issued ‘duty to warn’ notice to Inderjeet Singh Gosal, who worked as aide to Hardeep Singh Nijjar, who was gunned down in June 2023.

Revised indictment focuses on Donald Trump’s role as a political candidate seeking re-election, rather than as the president at the time.

New Zealander James Cutfield was put under investigation on Monday. Tech magnate Mike Lynch and six others died when yacht sank off Sicily.

Kennedy suspended independent election campaign to endorse Trump; Gabbard left Democrats in 2022 and is now popular among conservatives.

Lumen said it assessed the hacking campaign in the US and abroad was carried by alleged Chinese government-backed group ‘Volt Typhoon’.

South Korean President Yoon called for a crackdown on digital sex crimes amid rising deepfake abuse, highlighting the need for stronger legislation.

Russia warned the West against allowing Ukraine to strike deep into its territory, cautioning World War III would not be confined to Europe.

US Customs has detained nearly US$43 million worth of Indian electronics shipments since October 2022 under the Uygur Forced Labor Prevention Act, highlighting a new focus on enforcing the law.

Starmer warned of tax hikes for the wealthy to rebuild Britain, acknowledging tough choices ahead and the need to address societal divisions exacerbated by the previous government’s policies.

Record migration – driven by students from India, China and Philippines – expanded labour supply and restrained wage pressures, but it exacerbated an already tight housing market.

New Olympic champion kicks off bid for 25th major title as Coco Gauff makes solid start to her defence and Dominic Thiem says farewell.

Surging waters have burst through a dam and wiped out at least 20 villages, devastating a region already reeling from months of civil war.

The Asia Internet Coalition, which includes Google, Meta and X, urged Malaysia to halt its social media licensing plan, citing unclear regulations and potential innovation hindrance.

Swede Sven-Goran Eriksson, the first foreigner to manage England’s national football team, passed away at 76 after battling pancreatic cancer.

Joe Biden condemned strikes as ‘outrageous’, said Washington will continue surging energy equipment to Ukraine to support its energy grid.

James Cutfield, a 51-year-old New Zealand national, was one of 15 people who survived the sinking of the Bayesian, which left seven people dead.

The attacks targeted police stations, railway lines, and vehicles on highways, with the Baloch Liberation Army claiming responsibility for the violence.

The latest in a series of Sydney stabbings highlights the city’s troubling trend of stabbings and new knife laws.

Investigators allege the Russian-born billionaire’s platform has been used for money laundering and drug trafficking, among other offences.

In a blow to Boeing’s space programme, what was expected to be an eight-day mission to the International Space Station will last for months.

Gaza ceasefire and hostage negotiators discussed new compromise proposals in Cairo, as the UN reported worsening humanitarian conditions.

‘We don’t want to see Communist China win,’ says Donald Trump’s former UN envoy, who later ran against him for Republican presidential nod.
